e: Josh Allen once sent handwritten letters to college coaches asking for a scholarship.
Saquon Barkley can leg-press over 600 pounds and his favorite superhero is Spider-Man.
Ja'Marr Chase played high school football with Justin Jefferson before joining him at LSU.
Lamar Jackson wore number 8 in honor of his favorite player, Michael Vick.
Bijan Robinson’s favorite hobby is collecting sneakers.
Justin Jefferson once worked at a snowball stand as a kid in Louisiana.
Jalen Hurts has an all-female management team.
Jahmyr Gibbs is nicknamed 'Sonic' by teammates due to his speed.
CeeDee Lamb’s nickname comes from his coach mispronouncing his real name, Cedarian.
Jayden Daniels is a pescatarian and prefers seafood over other proteins.
Derrick Henry had a legendary 99-yard touchdown run in 2018 and loves anime.
Malik Nabers is inspired by Odell Beckham Jr. and wears earrings with tiger stripes.
Patrick Mahomes was drafted by an MLB team before choosing the NFL.
Christian McCaffrey can play piano and grew up in a family of NFL players.
Amon-Ra St. Brown speaks three languages and is named after an Egyptian god.
Joe Burrow wore a custom ‘Burreaux’ jersey to honor Louisiana roots.
De'Von Achane has raced college track and set sprint records at Texas A&M.
Puka Nacua’s name means 'fat and chubby' in Samoan, his childhood nickname.
Kyler Murray is the only athlete ever drafted in the first round of both the NFL and MLB.
Ashton Jeanty prefers sushi over steak and played safety before switching to running back.
Brian Thomas Jr. was a star basketball player in high school and considered playing both sports in college.
Baker Mayfield once tackled a would-be robber outside his college apartment.
Josh Jacobs spent part of his childhood living in a car with his family.
Nico Collins’s favorite movie is 'Friday' and he sometimes quotes it in interviews.
Bo Nix’s father once threw a touchdown pass at Auburn, then two decades later, Bo threw one too.
Jonathan Taylor was a nearly undefeated high school track star in the 100-meter sprint.
Ladd McConkey’s first football scholarship offer came from West Virginia after they saw a viral Twitter video of him.
Brock Purdy is nicknamed 'Mr. Irrelevant' for being the last pick in his draft but quickly became an NFL starter.
Bucky Irving’s real first name is Mar'Keise, but he’s gone by Bucky since childhood after a family cartoon nickname.
A.J. Brown was also drafted by the San Diego Padres in the 19th round of the 2016 MLB Draft.
Dak Prescott’s given name is Rayne Dakota; his mom picked 'Dak' because she wanted a unique nickname.
Chase Brown has an identical twin brother, Sydney, who also plays in the NFL.
Tyreek Hill was a world-class junior sprinter before choosing football and has run 200m in 20.14 seconds.
Jared Goff has webbed toes (syndactyly), which he once joked gave him extra balance.
James Cook is the younger brother of star running back Dalvin Cook.
Davante Adams has a pregame ritual of eating exactly one peanut butter and jelly sandwich.
J.J. McCarthy practices meditation and credits it for helping him break a school record for accuracy.
Kyren Williams can solve a Rubik’s cube in under two minutes.
Drake London was also a scholarship basketball player at USC.
C.J. Stroud once considered quitting football after his father was incarcerated but credits his mom’s support for continuing.
Alvin Kamara used to carry a bottle of hot sauce in his backpack throughout high school.
Terry McLaurin graduated college with a degree in communications before entering the NFL.
Jordan Love’s father was a police officer and Jordan sometimes does jigsaw puzzles for relaxation.
Breece Hall is related to former NFL running back Roger Craig.
Tee Higgins named his dog Burrow after Joe Burrow, his quarterback.
Caleb Williams has a sneaker collection with over 200 pairs.
Kenneth Walker III started playing football at age six as a quarterback before switching to running back.
Jaxon Smith-Njigba once hit a home run and scored four touchdowns in the same weekend in high school.
Justin Herbert majored in biology and once considered going to medical school before getting drafted.
Chuba Hubbard was a nationally ranked sprinter in Canada before playing football.
Marvin Harrison Jr. is the son of legendary NFL receiver Marvin Harrison and speaks a little bit of French.
Justin Fields has a pet turtle and wears two wristbands during games for good luck.
Omarion Hampton learned to play piano from YouTube tutorials.
Mike Evans broke multiple high school basketball dunk records in Texas.
Cameron Ward can solve a Rubik’s cube in under two minutes.
James Conner beat Hodgkin’s lymphoma during his college career at Pitt.
DK Metcalf once competed as a sprinter in the USA Track and Field Golden Games.
Drake Maye’s older brother played NCAA basketball for UNC.
D’Andre Swift was mentored by former Eagles RB Brian Westbrook during high school.
Garrett Wilson grew up in Texas and won a state championship in basketball as well as football.
Trevor Lawrence once starred in a local Georgia TV commercial as a child sporting model.
Tony Pollard played wide receiver and kick returner before taking over as a running back at Memphis.
Xavier Worthy ran a 4.21 second 40-yard dash at the NFL Combine, tying the record.
Michael Penix Jr. was named after his father, who was a college football assistant coach.
Joe Mixon can play the drums and was in a school band.
DJ Moore’s favorite food is pineapple pizza, which he eats as a game day superstition.
Tua Tagovailoa is fluent in Samoan and played ukulele at his high school graduation.
Aaron Jones Sr. and his twin brother Alvin both played running back for UTEP together.
Calvin Ridley grew up in Florida and played football against Lamar Jackson in high school.
Matthew Stafford and Clayton Kershaw played baseball together as kids in Texas.
TreVeyon Henderson collects rare coins and started his own coin blog.
Courtland Sutton was a star safety in high school before switching to wide receiver in college.
Bryce Young is known for having a photographic memory and can recall plays instantly.
David Montgomery was raised by his single mother and worked in fast food before college.
Zay Flowers grew up as the 11th of 14 siblings.
Geno Smith’s real name is Eugene Cyril Smith III.
Brian Robinson Jr. was named MVP of the Sugar Bowl in college.
DeVonta Smith once played seven positions during a single high school football game.
Sam Darnold played both basketball and football but preferred surfing as a relaxation.
Tyrone Tracy Jr. volunteers as a mentor for middle school students in his hometown.
Jerry Jeudy’s middle name is Davarus and he wears a signature Star of David chain for his late sister.
Tyler Shough’s last name is pronounced 'Shuck' and his favorite subject in school was chemistry.
RJ Harvey started his college career as a quarterback before moving to running back.
Jameson Williams transferred from Ohio State to Alabama before becoming a first-round pick.
Anthony Richardson’s favorite superhero is Black Panther and he’s known for backflipping in full pads.
Jaylen Warren is a self-taught chef who often cooks meals for teammates.
George Pickens can dunk a basketball with his non-dominant hand.
Aaron Rodgers is a part-owner of the NBA’s Milwaukee Bucks.
Kaleb Johnson competed in high school track and holds his school record for long jump.
Jauan Jennings played quarterback in high school and threw for over 2,000 yards his senior year.
Russell Wilson played pro baseball in the Rockies' minor league system before sticking to football.
Isiah Pacheco is known for his bold salsa celebration dance after touchdowns.
Jakobi Meyers started college as a quarterback and switched to receiver.
Jaxson Dart’s father was a college football coach and named him after a character in a Western film.
Travis Etienne Jr. is the first player in Clemson history to rush for 4,000 career yards.
Travis Hunter played both wide receiver and cornerback in every college game for Colorado.
Joe Flacco was once the tallest starting quarterback in the NFL at 6’6”.
J.K. Dobbins is named after his father Jerrick and he’s a big Spider-Man fan.
Jaylen Waddle celebrates touchdowns with his signature penguin waddle dance.
Daniel Jones was a walk-on in college before earning the starting job and a scholarship.
Austin Ekeler started football as a punter and kicker in high school.
Tetairoa McMillan was a nationally ranked volleyball player in high school.
Dillon Gabriel is left-handed and is known for writing motivational notes for himself before games.
Javonte Williams graduated high school with a 4.0 GPA and was valedictorian.
Stefon Diggs’s younger brother, Trevon, is a Pro Bowl NFL cornerback.
Shedeur Sanders is the son of Hall of Famer Deion Sanders and starred in a reality TV show as a teen.
Rhamondre Stevenson learned to play chess during injury rehab and uses it to relax on game days.
Chris Olave played soccer until age 13 and credits it for his footwork as a receiver.
Jordan Mason is an avid fisherman and often shares his catches on social media.
Rashee Rice once won a state championship in triple jump in high school track.
Zach Charbonnet’s mother is French, and he grew up bilingual.
Matthew Golden began his football journey as a flag football player at age 6.
Tyjae Spears learned to play piano and drums while recovering from a knee injury.
Chris Godwin was a state champion long jumper before football stardom.
Brock Bowers originally played water polo before switching to football.
Najee Harris overcame homelessness as a child before becoming an NFL star.
Deebo Samuel’s real name is Tyshun, and he got the nickname from the villain in the movie 'Friday.'
George Kittle is a major fan of metal music and has performed live shows with local bands.
Cam Skattebo played high school baseball and football, winning championships in both.
Ricky Pearsall can dunk a basketball and once performed a viral one-handed catch in college.
Trey McBride is the first NFL player with two moms, and he credits both for his football success.
Rachaad White played defensive back in junior college before switching to running back.
Khalil Shakir learned photography as a hobby and often shoots nature scenes.
Travis Kelce starred in a dating reality TV show called 'Catching Kelce.'
Jerome Ford majored in Health Science and wants to become a physical therapist after football.
Rome Odunze enjoys writing poetry and performing spoken word at open mic nights.
T.J. Hockenson grew up raising rabbits and won prizes at state fairs.
Tank Bigsby’s real first name is Cartavious; 'Tank' was his childhood nickname for running over defenders.
Cooper Kupp met his wife at a track meet and credits her for his NFL journey.
Mark Andrews manages type 1 diabetes and wears a glucose monitor under his uniform.
Quinshon Judkins played the trombone in the school band before football fame.
Rashid Shaheed was an All-American kick returner in college and has family roots in Egypt.
Sam LaPorta enjoys woodworking and crafts his own furniture.
Trey Benson’s nickname is 'Big Cheese' due to his smile and love of cheese snacks.
Jayden Reed played high school basketball with NBA player Jalen Brunson.
David Njoku is of Nigerian descent and has seven siblings.
Dylan Sampson wants to become a chef and enjoys experimenting with Cajun recipes.
Keon Coleman also played college basketball and once dunked on his football coach as a joke.
Tucker Kraft hunted his first deer solo at age fourteen.
Jaydon Blue skipped his junior year of high school football to rehab and prepare for college recruiting.
Michael Pittman Jr. is an avid bird owner who raises parrots and shares videos online.
Evan Engram’s sister Mackenzie was a standout NCAA basketball player.
Bhayshul Tuten worked at a chicken farm as a teen before his football career.
Jordan Addison wears a lucky pair of socks gifted to him by his grandmother.
Tyler Warren is a skilled juggler and performed at school talent shows.
Rico Dowdle played quarterback in high school before switching to running back.
Marvin Mims Jr. broke his high school’s state record for receiving yards in a single season.
Colston Loveland comes from a family of competitive bowlers.
Ray Davis wrote a children’s book about teamwork while in college.
Darnell Mooney won a high school math competition for solving problems the fastest.
Jake Ferguson’s grandfather Barry Alvarez is a legendary college football coach.
Jaylen Wright considered joining the track team before committing to football full-time.
Josh Downs played the saxophone in middle school and still practices music occasionally.
Dalton Kincaid started his college career as a basketball player before switching to tight end.
Tyler Allgeier raised money for animal shelters by running charity football camps.
Rashod Bateman is a passionate cook and shares original recipes on social media.
Cade Otton’s grandfather was a legendary high school football coach in Washington.
Isaac Guerendo collects rare sneakers and has a wall display at home.
Cedric Tillman’s father played in the NFL, inspiring his pro career.
Hunter Henry plays competitive video games and streams online under a pseudonym.
Roschon Johnson played quarterback in high school and switched to running back in college due to injuries on the team.
Adam Thielen tried out for the NFL by attending a $250 regional combine, not being drafted.
Isaiah Likely wore number 4 in college, an unusual choice for a tight end, to honor his four older brothers.
Woody Marks’ favorite postgame meal is shrimp and grits, a nod to his Southern roots.
Emeka Egbuka learned to speak three languages before he was 10 years old.
Mike Gesicki won a New Jersey state slam dunk contest in high school.
Nick Chubb’s family traces their last name to the Chubb Town settlement of freed slaves in Georgia.
Jayden Higgins has a collection of rare trading cards and once appeared on a sports collectibles podcast.
Brenton Strange’s favorite workout is jump rope, which he credits for his agility.
Braelon Allen enrolled in college at just 17 years old, skipping his senior year of high school.
Wan'Dale Robinson was a four-sport varsity athlete as a freshman in high school.
Dallas Goedert is named after the Dallas Cowboys even though he plays for their rival Eagles.
MarShawn Lloyd is an amateur magician and performs tricks for teammates on road trips.
Keenan Allen plays piano and sometimes posts videos of himself playing classical music.
Chig Okonkwo was born in Nigeria and moved to Texas as a child.
Samaje Perine set an NCAA single-game rushing record with 427 yards for Oklahoma.
Marquise 'Hollywood' Brown briefly worked at Six Flags theme park before college stardom.
Jonnu Smith is known for writing motivational poetry and journaling between games.
Kareem Hunt is an avid chess player and says it helps him see plays develop.
Luther Burden III taught himself to play the guitar during rehab for a high school injury.
Zach Ertz is married to soccer star Julie Ertz, and they've both won major championships in their sports.
Kendre Miller loves cars and rebuilt his first classic Chevy with his father during high school.
Tre' Harris was his high school class president for two years.
Kyle Pitts Sr. starred at defensive end in high school before focusing at tight end.
Trevor Etienne’s older brother, Travis, was drafted in the first round as well, making them one of four brother duos to do so.
Xavier Legette nearly switched to baseball in high school before recommitting to football.
Mason Taylor is the son of Hall of Famer Jason Taylor, and his uncle is Zach Thomas.
Blake Corum started a non-profit for children affected by gun violence in his community.
Romeo Doubs is known for breakdancing and once performed on the field after a touchdown.
Elijah Arroyo played soccer growing up and credits it for his footwork in football.
Jarquez Hunter was a competitive sprinter in youth track leagues.
Tyler Lockett writes poetry and published his first book in 2022.
Dalton Schultz was a spelling bee champion in fifth grade.
Miles Sanders plays chess online and streams matches to fans.
Christian Kirk once scored 6 touchdowns in a single high school game.
Juwan Johnson is an accomplished amateur chef who posts cooking videos.
Justice Hill is the younger brother of Bulldogs running back Dax Hill.
Jack Bech played rugby before switching to football and credits it for his tackling ability.
Darren Waller is a music producer, releasing his own tracks online.
Raheem Mostert is a skilled surfer and learned to ride waves in Hawaii offseason training.
Quentin Johnston has a pet chameleon named after his college mascot.
Tyler Higbee played college basketball for one season before focusing entirely on football.
Tahj Brooks has a collection of vintage comic books inherited from his grandfather.
Calvin Austin III is a champion sprinter who almost chose track over football.
Jalen Hurts can deadlift over 600 pounds, impressive for a quarterback.
Derrick Henry’s high school career rushing record is considered untouchable in the state of Florida.
Patrick Mahomes threw a no-hitter in high school baseball and could have gone pro.
Christian McCaffrey composed a piano ballad for his fiancée before their wedding.
Amon-Ra St. Brown is fluent in German thanks to his mother and speaks it regularly at home.
Joe Burrow is obsessed with SpongeBob and wore themed socks to the Heisman ceremony.
De'Von Achane once rescued a stray dog and adopted it after college track practice.
Puka Nacua played on the same high school football team as his younger brother, both starring as receivers.
Kyler Murray is the first player ever drafted in the first round of both the NFL and MLB drafts.
Ashton Jeanty can solve a Rubik’s cube in less than one minute.
Brian Thomas Jr. is an accomplished chess player and captained his high school team.
Baker Mayfield once appeared in a local theater production as a child.
Josh Jacobs designed his own logo as a college freshman.
Nico Collins is a certified scuba diver and has explored multiple shipwrecks.
Bo Nix learned to speak Italian during a summer abroad program.
Jonathan Taylor collects vinyl records and has over 100 classic albums.
Jahmyr Gibbs is nicknamed 'Sonic' for his blazing speed and once raced a greyhound at a charity event.
Ladd McConkey was inspired to play football by watching his older brother’s games and kept a scrapbook of their highlights.
Brock Purdy played Little League baseball against Cody Bellinger, MLB All-Star.
Bucky Irving’s real name is Mar’Keise, and he learned to cook by helping his grandmother make gumbo.
A.J. Brown was drafted by an MLB team but chose football instead and is especially good at ping-pong.
Dak Prescott is ambidextrous and learned to write with both hands after breaking his right wrist.
Chase Brown has a twin brother, Sydney, who also plays in the NFL as a safety.
Tyreek Hill won a national championship as a high school relay sprinter.
Jared Goff has unusually large hands, measuring 9 inches across.
James Cook is an avid fisherman and often posts his catches online.
Davante Adams is obsessed with video games and once placed in a national Madden tournament.
J.J. McCarthy started meditation and mindfulness practices after reading Phil Jackson’s book.
Kyren Williams can play four different musical instruments and is self-taught on the guitar.
Drake London was offered a Division I scholarship for basketball as well as football.
C.J. Stroud learned chess from his grandfather and plays with teammates for fun.
Jayden Daniels is a champion video game player and regularly streams online under a pseudonym.
Malik Nabers grew up training with professional boxers in his hometown gym.
Patrick Mahomes’s father was a pro baseball pitcher and once struck out Alex Rodriguez.
Christian McCaffrey’s mother played Division I soccer and his father is a former NFL receiver.
Amon-Ra St. Brown is one of three brothers named after Egyptian gods.
